title: AVP, Asset Liability Modeling
content:
Job Summary
The AVP, Actuarial Asset Liability Modeling is responsible for multiple actuarial asset/liability projections for F&G Annuities & Life. This individual will lead a team that updates and executes actuarial asset/liability projections, including controls, and analyzes and communicates results. 
This role will report to the VP, Actuarial Asset Liability Modeling and will manage a team of 3-6 individuals.
Duties and Responsibilities

Provide leadership in utilizing corporate models for analysis and evaluation of key strategic initiatives.
Foster strong model governance and controls environment, including maintaining comprehensive documentation and executing controlled processes and procedures.
Lead and collaborate with various teams to understand, develop, and implement model specifications for completing asset/liabiliy projections.
Lead team to complete accurate and timely model projections and analysis.
Ad hoc activities as requested by executive management.

Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science or related field.
FSA preferred, ASA required.
Seven - Ten years of related actuarial experience.
Experience effectively managing a team.
Experience with and knowledge of AXIS (preferred) or similar actuarial modeling software is required.
Experience within the Fixed Indexed Annuity, Indexed Universal Life or Pension Risk Transfer lines of business, as well as reinsurance preferred.
Experience with modeling applications that calculate or project US statutory and US GAAP quantities preferred (e.g., Financial Reporting, Pricing, Asset/Liability Management, Cash Flow Testing).

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Highly organized, attentive to details, committed to delivering accurate information on schedule.
Excellent communicator to all levels. Provides clear direction with a results-oriented style.
Disciplined commitment to model governance protocols.
Strong understanding of actuarial projections and interactions between various product features and actuarial calculation results.
Strong problem-solving skills that include advanced analytical and reasoning abilities to apply actuarial concepts to complex situations.
Team player with demonstrated ability to proactively identify issues and to influence key project decisions to achieve desired outcomes. Initiative, adaptability and flexibility to produce results.
Some travel may be required (less than 5%).

F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.

As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic.
